title.narrative: Provision of life-saving multi-sectoral assistance targeting new arrivals and displaced populations in north-east Nigeria

description.narrative:
Since the inception of the counter insurgency operations in 2017, the trend of new arrivals from hard-to reach areas to accessible locations across Borno State has increased significantly and at an alarming rate – The period of November 2018 to January 2019 saw a record of 71,807 arrivals from hard-to-reach areas to accessible areas more than 44,000 arrived in January alone. Among the new arrivals conflict and insecurity is cited as the key trigger of displacement (IOM Displacement Tracing Matrix, Emergency Tracking Tool).
The rapid and alarming rate of new arrivals is leading to over-congestion in camp and camp-like settings. To illustrate, in Teachers Village, Maiduguri, capacity has been stretched from 5,000 to 28,000 people in one-month.This has put existing Shelter and Non-Food Items (NFIs), and Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) services under great strain and continued pressure, particularly with regard to supporting new arrivals and displaced populations hosted in camp and camp-like settings.
In response to the needs identified and the strategy defined by the CCCM/Shelter-NFI, and WASH sector IOM will through this project support the continuation and scaling-up of assistance within the areas of (1) Emergency shelter and Non-Food Items (NFI) and (2) WASH. In the area of Emergency Shelter and NFI IOM will: (a) distribute improved NFI kits in response to the urgent life-saving needs of new arrivals and displaced populations in camp and camp-like settings in Monguno (b) distribute improved emergency shelters kits in response to urgent needs of new arrival and displaced populations in camp and camp-like settings across Monguno and (c) rehabilitate and partition damaged public buildings in order to provide accommodation for displaced populations and new arrivals in camp and camp-like settings in Monguno. In the area of WASH IOM will: (a) ensure access to safe water facilities and services across all sub-groups of the affected population through the drilling, installation, maintenance and rehabilitation of boreholes (b) construct, operate and maintain sanitation facilities (latrines, showers, hand washing stations) and (c) establish, train and equip existing and newly established community-based WASH committees to support improved sanitation as well as hygiene outcomes and practices of new arrivals and displaced populations in targeted camp and camp-like settings. Activities are to be implemented in compliment to ensure a timely and holistic response to the multi-sectoral needs of displaced populations in camp and camp-like settings in Monguno, Jere and Maiduguri Metropolitan Council (MMC).
